purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 屿)
Pictophonetic: 與 indicates the sound; 山 (mountain) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 山 [ shān ] mountain, hill, peak
    • 與 [ yǔ ] and; with; to; for; to give, to grant
heisig_chinese_memo: The gods will only offer a mountain to you if you do something really amazing.  They do offer an islet (small islands) to lower level achievements though!
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the mountain (山) you're granted (與) is on an islet
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The gods will only offer a mountain to you if you do something really amazing.  They do offer an islet (small islands) to lower level achievements though!
humanum_full_description_en:
From " mountain ", " and " sound. The original meaning is small island. "Shuowen New Attachment": "Yu, 㠀 also. From the mountain, with the sound." "Jade Chapter. "Mountain Department": "Island, Haizhongzhou." Such as "Xijing Miscellaneous Notes. Third: "The accumulation of sand is the island, the rushing water is the wave." "Selected Works. Xie Lingyun's "Lantau Island in the Dengjiang River": "The turbulent currents are turning right, and the Lantau Island enchants Zhongchuan." Meng Haoran in the Tang Dynasty "The Lantau Island in the Dengjiang River gives a gift to Mr. Baiyun Wang Jiong": "The river is clear and the water flows out of the sand island.

" Island " and " Island " are used together to represent the general term for islands. Such as "Selected Works. Zuo Taichong "Fu Du": "Island Mianmiao, Zhouzhu Fenglong." Tang Dynasty Li Dong "Send Yunqing Master to Annan": "Island is divided into various countries, galaxy is one day." Yao Nai in Qing Dynasty "Jiang Xing": "Lost in the vertical and horizontal islands, there are clouds and clouds."

" Island " also refers to the hills on the flat ground, as in the Southern Song Dynasty Dai Tong's "The Story of Six Books. Geography II": "Island, Xu and Chi, flat hills, land is the island, and the water is the island." Yuan Hongdao in the Ming Dynasty "Songyou Fifth": "The mountain in the center is Yiping, then it is the island. For the sake of my cloth banquet."
humanum_short_description_en: From " mountain ", " and " sound. The original meaning is small island.
humanum_full_description:
從「山」，「與」聲。本義為小島。《說文新附》：「嶼，㠀也。从山，與聲。」《玉篇．山部》：「嶼，海中洲。」如《西京雜記．第三》：「積沙為洲嶼，激水為波潮。」《文選．謝靈運〈登江中孤嶼〉》：「亂流趨正絕，孤嶼媚中川。」唐代孟浩然〈登江中孤嶼贈白雲先生王迥〉：「悠悠清江水，水落沙嶼出。」

　　「島」「嶼」連用，表示島的總稱。如《文選．左太沖〈吳都賦〉》：「島嶼緜邈，洲渚馮隆。」唐代李洞〈送雲卿上人游安南〉：「島嶼分諸國，星河共一天。」清代姚鼐〈江行〉：「縱橫島嶼中流失，繚繞雲煙萬里空。」

　　「嶼」也表示平地上的小山，如南宋戴侗《六書故．地理二》：「嶼，徐與切，平地小山也，在陸為嶼，在水為島。」明代袁宏道〈嵩游第五〉：「中央之山宜平，則為坻為嶼，若以供吾布席置酒之用也。」

Chinese: The gods will only offer a mountain to you if you do something really amazing. They do offer an islet (small islands) to lower level achievements though!
Meaning: islet
Hanzi: 屿
Story: The gods will only offer a mountain to you if you do something really amazing. They do offer an islet (small islands) to lower level achievements though!
Kind: traditional

從「 山 」，「 與 」聲。本義為小島。《說文新附》：「嶼，㠀也。从山，與聲。」《玉篇．山部》：「嶼，海中洲。」如《西京雜記．第三》：「積沙為洲嶼，激水為波潮。」《文選．謝靈運〈登江中孤嶼〉》：「亂流趨正絕，孤嶼媚中川。」唐代孟浩然〈登江中孤嶼贈白雲先生王迥〉：「悠悠清江水，水落沙嶼出。」 「 島 」「 嶼 」連用，表示島的總稱。如《文選．左太沖〈吳都賦〉》：「島嶼緜邈，洲渚馮隆。」唐代李洞〈送雲卿上人游安南〉：「島嶼分諸國，星河共一天。」清代姚鼐〈江行〉：「縱橫島嶼中流失，繚繞雲煙萬里空。」 「 嶼 」也表示平地上的小山，如南宋戴侗《六書故．地理二》：「嶼，徐與切，平地小山也，在陸為嶼，在水為島。」明代袁宏道〈嵩游第五〉：「中央之山宜平，則為坻為嶼，若以供吾布席置酒之用也。」

"Mountain Department": "Island, Haizhongzhou." Such as "Xijing Miscellaneous Notes. Third: "The accumulation of sand is the island, the rushing water is the wave." "Selected Works. Xie Lingyun's "Lantau Island in the Dengjiang River": "The turbulent currents are turning right, and the Lantau Island enchants Zhongchuan." Meng Haoran in the Tang Dynasty "The Lantau Island in the Dengjiang River gives a gift to Mr. Baiyun Wang Jiong": "The river is clear and the water flows out of the sand island. " Island" and " Island" are used together to represent the general term for islands. Such as "Selected Works. Zuo Taichong "Fu Du": "Island Mianmiao, Zhouzhu Fenglong." Tang Dynasty Li Dong "Send Yunqing Master to Annan": "Island is divided into various countries, galaxy is one day." Yao Nai in Qing Dynasty "Jiang Xing": "Lost in the vertical and horizontal islands, there are clouds and clouds." " Island" also refers to the hills on the flat ground, as in the Southern Song Dynasty Dai Tong's "The Story of Six Books. Geography II": "Island, Xu and Chi, flat hills, land is the island, and the water is the island." Yuan Hongdao in the Ming Dynasty "Songyou Fifth": "The mountain in the center is Yiping, then it is the island. For the sake of my cloth banquet."

嶼字的基本解释

嶼
yǔ
见“屿”。

嶼字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yǔ］
［《廣韻》徐吕切，上語，邪。］
“屿1”的繁体字。
(1)小岛。
(2)平地小山。

嶼字的康熙字典解释

【寅集中】【山字部】　嶼； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页321第25
【唐韻】徐呂切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】象呂切，?胥上聲。【說文】島也。【廣韻】海中洲。【六書故】平地小山，在水爲島，在陸爲嶼。【謝靈運·登江中孤嶼詩】孤嶼媚中川。【郭璞·江賦】石帆蒙蘢以蓋嶼。　【集韻】一作?。
